en: He rarely gets angry.
He seldom writes to his father.
He hardly ever works.
He rarely gives up.
He has seldom had a meal with his family.
zh: 他很少和家人一起吃饭。

en: He scarcely ever watches TV.
Seldom did he visit there.
He seldom went there.
He rarely went there.
He almost never went there.
He rarely gives in, confronted with difficulties.
He is making great progress in English.
He was appointed Japanese minister to Mexico.
zh: 他被任命为日本驻墨西哥公使。

en: I met her during my stay in Mexico.
zh: 我在墨西哥待着的时候见过她。

en: He pronounces English words in Spanish fashion because he is a Mexican.
zh: 他是墨西哥人，所以说起英语来一股西班牙味。

en: He has a lot of difficulty seeing without his glasses.
zh: 他不戴眼镜的话，基本看不清东西。

en: Even with his glasses, he doesn't see very well.
zh: 就算戴着眼镜，他也看不大清。

en: He wore glasses.
He was wearing glasses.
He has a maid to wait on him.
He has a maid.
He employs a maid.
They made fun of Mary.
He put the ring on Mary's finger.
zh: 他把戒指戴在了玛丽的手指上。

en: He is Mary's brother, I should think.
zh: 我想他应该是玛丽的兄弟。

en: I think he's Mary's older brother.
zh: 我觉得他是玛丽的哥哥。

en: He explained to Mary why he was late for her birthday party.
zh: 他跟玛丽解释了为什么他参加她的生日派对迟到了。

en: He's head over heels in love with Mary.
He sent a card to Mary.
Did he go to see Mary?
He has a date with Mary this afternoon.
zh: 他今天下午和玛丽有个约会。

en: He was sitting between Mary and Tom.
zh: 他坐在玛丽和汤姆中间。

en: He finally realized that Mary had made a fool of him.
zh: 他最后终于发现自己被玛丽给耍了。

en: He wished Mary had told him the story.
zh: 他真希望玛丽当时把那件事告诉了他。

en: He courted disaster by reckless driving.
zh: 他开车那么猛，简直是在玩命。

en: He gave me everything but took nothing in return.
zh: 他给了我一切，却没要任何回报。

en: He knows the art of making people feel at home.
zh: 他很擅长让人感到宾至如归。

en: He makes everybody feel at ease.
zh: 他让大家都觉得很放松。

en: He ran the fastest of all.
He was laughed at by everybody.
Everyone laughed at him.
He is well spoken of by everybody.
He is left out of everything.
He has been loved by all.
zh: 他一直深受大家的喜爱。

en: He came after everybody had come.
zh: 大家全到了之后他才来。

en: He spoke slowly enough for everyone to understand.
zh: 他说得够慢了，大家都能听懂。

en: He wanted to be respected by everybody.
He is liked by everybody.
They were all surprised to see me there.
zh: 他们在那儿见到我都很吃惊。

en: He drank a whole bottle of milk.
He is proud of being a musician.
zh: 他为自己是音乐家而感到自豪。

en: He didn't know the fact that everyone knew.
zh: 大家都知道的事，就他不知道。

en: He is a tin god.
He stuck a meatball with his fork.
zh: 他用叉子叉起了一个肉丸子。

en: He was fairly caught in the trap.
He was easily deceived and gave her some money.
zh: 他太好骗了，直接就给了她一些钱。

en: He is kind to those around him.
zh: 他对他周围的人都挺好的。

en: He will often go out for the whole day.
zh: 他经常一出去就是一整天。

en: He talks as if he were an old man.
zh: 他说话跟个老头子似的。

en: He felt as if he were in a dream.
zh: 他觉得就像在做梦一样。

en: It seems like he had never met his father before.
zh: 搞得跟他以前从没见过他爸似的。

en: He looks as if he were ill.
He lives as if he were a millionaire.
zh: 他过得跟个百万富翁似的。

en: He speaks as if he knew the criminal.
zh: 他说得好像认识那个罪犯似的。

en: He went to the seaside only to be drowned.
zh: 他去了海边，结果却淹死了。

en: He speaks as if he were an expert.
He talks as if he were a teacher.
zh: 他说话那样子像个老师。

en: He reddened like a schoolboy.
zh: 他像个小男生那样脸红了。

en: He told me about the accident as if he had seen it with his own eyes.
zh: 他跟我讲起那场意外，就像亲眼看见了一样。

en: He was so childish that he couldn't resist temptation.
zh: 他太幼稚了，禁不起诱惑。

en: Because he was just like a child, he yielded to temptation.
zh: 因为他就像个孩子，所以就禁不住诱惑。

en: He behaved as if he were crazy.
He looked as if he had not eaten for days.
zh: 他看着像好几天没吃饭了。

en: He looked as if nothing had happened.
zh: 他看着像什么都没发生过一样。

en: He speaks as though he knew everything.
zh: 他说起话来好像什么都懂。

en: He acts as if he were a king.
zh: 他那样子跟个国王似的。

en: He speaks English as well as though he were an Englishman.
zh: 他英语说得跟英国人一样好。

en: He speaks as if he had read the book before.
zh: 他说起来就像以前读过那本书似的。

en: He talks as if he knew the secret.
zh: 他说话像知道那个秘密似的。

en: He speaks as if he knew everything.
zh: 他说起话来像什么都知道。

en: He talks as if he knew everything under the sun.
zh: 他聊起天来像无所不知。

en: He speaks English as if he were an American.
zh: 他英语说得像个美国人。

en: He speaks as if he were an American.
He cried as if he were a boy of six.
zh: 他哭得像个六岁的孩子。

en: He showed his disapproval by raising an eyebrow.
zh: 他挑了下眉毛，表示不赞成。

en: He timed her in the marathon race.
zh: 他在马拉松比赛中为她计时。

en: He soon walked away.
He will come back soon.
I'm sure he'll be along soon.
zh: 我肯定他很快就会过来的。

en: It will not be long before he recovers from his illness.
It was not long before he arrived.
He is likely to arrive soon.
He leaves the parental roof soon.
zh: 他很快就要搬出去住了。

en: He was soon acclimated to his new job.
zh: 他很快就适应了新工作。

en: He prepared for his imminent departure.
zh: 他为即将出发做好了准备。

en: He will return to the game soon.
He will be back before long.
He will be back soon.
He soon got accustomed to dormitory life and made two or three friends.
zh: 他很快就适应了宿舍生活，还交了两三个朋友。

en: It won't be long before he comes to himself.
zh: 他很快就会苏醒过来的。

en: He will return from Europe soon.
It won't be long before he can play baseball again.
zh: 要不了多久他就能再打棒球了。

en: He soon recovered from the illness.
Will he be here soon?
He will soon get used to the climate here.
zh: 他很快就会习惯这里的气候的。

en: He objected to the opinion of his manager.
He was so stupid as to tell a lie that might easily be found out.
zh: 他真傻，撒了个这么容易被拆穿的谎。

en: He was disappointed at not being invited.
zh: 他因为没被邀请而感到很失望。

en: He struck a match, but quickly put it out.
zh: 他划了一根火柴，但很快就吹灭了。

en: He struck a match.
He is totally dependent on his parents.
He looks just like his mother.
zh: 他长得跟他妈妈一模一样。

en: He was not at all satisfied.
He is just an ordinary person.
He is not altogether a fool.
He has absolutely no respect for other people's feelings.
zh: 他完全不顾及别人的感受。

en: He is not honest at all.
He is entirely ignorant of the world.
zh: 他对人情世故一窍不通。

en: He doesn't altogether trust me.
He has quite a novel idea.
He is quite in the wrong.
He is quite young in spirit.
He is quite a clever man.
He wasn't exactly a stranger.
zh: 他并不完全是个陌生人。

en: He lives in the woods all by himself.
He is heart and soul a Democrat.
zh: 他是个地道的民主党人。

en: He is dead to all sense of shame.
He is a gentleman in every way.
zh: 他各方面表现都像个绅士。

en: He is quite a gentleman.
He's quite crazy about golfing.
zh: 他对打高尔夫球很着迷。

en: He was an utter stranger.
He does not watch TV at all.
He stood in an upright position.
He fell head-long into the river.
He took poison by mistake.
He's still sponging off his parents.
He is still dependent on his parents.
He has made a promise to come again.
He is still standing.
He has not come yet. He may have missed the train.
zh: 他还没来，可能没赶上火车。

en: He has not come yet. Something may have happened to him.
zh: 他还没来，可能出什么事了。

en: He hasn't come yet. He must have missed the bus.
zh: 他还没来，肯定没赶上公交。

en: He hasn't come yet.
He's not here yet.
He isn't here yet.
He still wants to come.
He is too young to benefit from firm discipline.
zh: 他还太小，严厉的管教对他没用。

en: He came back again.
He is hardly more than a lad.
He doesn't want to leave the room because he's afraid that he'll catch another cold.
He had the sensation that he was still on the waves.
zh: 他感觉自己好像还在浪尖上晃悠。

en: He was also kind to animals.
He is still angry.
He is still not accustomed to city life.
zh: 他还不习惯城里的生活。

en: He hasn't arrived yet.
The news that he was still alive reached us.
zh: 有消息传来说他还活着。

en: It is said that he is still alive.
People say that he's still alive.
I hear that he's still alive.
They say that he's still alive.
He is still alive.
He hasn't come of age yet.
He is still sound in mind and body.
zh: 他身体和精神都还挺硬朗的。

en: The boss just chewed him out again.
zh: 老板刚才又把他臭骂了一顿。

en: He still has three servants.
He went to sea when he was only 14.
He made every effort to avoid yielding to the temptation to start drinking again.
zh: 他拼命克制自己，不让自己忍不住再喝酒。

en: He hasn't written the letter yet.
He still has not written the letter.
He is still young.
He's still young.
Did he fail again?
Has he failed again?
He is ashamed that he has failed again.
zh: 他又失败了，觉得挺丢脸的。

en: He has not realized his mistakes yet.
zh: 他还没意识到自己的错误。

en: He still sticks to his opinion.
zh: 他还是坚持自己的想法。

en: He lectured us about his pet theories again.
zh: 他又跟我们唠叨他那一套理论了。

en: He is yet to know the truth.
He doesn't know the truth yet.
He doesn't yet know the truth.
zh: 他到现在还不知道真相。

en: He hasn't appeared yet.
I have not yet done with the work.
zh: 我手头的活儿还没干完。

en: He isn't back from the mountain.
He lost his umbrella again.
He is not down yet.
He is still full of energy.
He isn't back yet. He may have had an accident.
zh: 他还没回来，可能是出什么事了。

en: He hasn't returned yet.
He still keeps up his interest in music.
zh: 他对音乐的兴趣一点儿没减。

en: He has not come home yet, has he?
He is not old enough to live alone.
zh: 他还没到能一个人住的年纪。

en: He has not yet recovered consciousness.
He slipped into the bad habit again.
He is just a kid.
He is still sitting on the bench.
He still holds the heavyweight title.
He is still in bed.
He is still very much alive.
He is said to still be in Paris.
He is still somewhere about.
He is as great a thinker as ever lived.
zh: 他是古往今来最伟大的思想家。

en: He could still be alive somewhere.
zh: 他可能还活在世上的某个地方。

en: He's just crying wolf again.
zh: 他又在玩“狼来了”那一套了。

en: He is still on the payroll of the company.
zh: 他还在那家公司领薪水呢。

en: He came here again.
He'll be here again.
He is still here.
Is he still here?
He has yet to get in touch with his mother.
He is still angry with you for your conduct.
zh: 他还在为你的行为生你的气。

en: He is still on the right side of forty.
He's only twelve, but he plays chess with the best of them.
zh: 他才十二岁，但下棋跟那些高手比起来一点都不差。

en: He started off with a good breakfast.
zh: 他先吃了一顿丰盛的早餐。

en: He is a kind of gentleman.
He began with a joke.
He began his lecture with a humorous anecdote.
zh: 他讲座的开头讲了一个幽默的小故事。

en: He seldom, if ever, laughs.
zh: 他很少笑，甚至几乎不笑。

en: He seldom, if ever, goes to the barber's.
zh: 他很少去理发店，甚至几乎不去。

en: He spoke on more and more eloquently.
He became more and more famous.
He started his day with a good breakfast.
zh: 他的一天是从一顿丰盛的早餐开始的。

en: He came at an inopportune time.
The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and tell him.
zh: 安德鲁做的第一件事就是找到他兄弟西门，并把这事儿告诉了他。

en: He began to study in earnest.
zh: 他开始认真钻研起来了。

en: He led a sober life.
He is an earnest young man.
zh: 他是个很认真的小伙子。

en: He was just on the verge of going to sleep.
He was about to call her up, when her letter came.
zh: 他正要给她打电话，她的信就到了。

en: He is certainly a model English gentleman.
zh: 他绝对是标准的英国绅士。

en: He made a speech highly appropriate to the occasion.
zh: 他的演讲非常得体，很合时宜。

en: He is the Edison of Japan.
He was really a child of his times.
zh: 他真是那个时代的产物。

en: He has no less than 100 dollars.
zh: 他手里少说也有一百美元。

en: He is indeed a clever boy.
zh: 他确实是个聪明的孩子。

en: He plays the role of Macbeth with great skill.
zh: 他演麦克白演得非常有水平。

en: He repairs his own car.
What an eloquent speaker he is!!
He has, say, fifty thousand yen.
He seldom, if ever, goes to church.
zh: 他很少去教堂，甚至几乎不去。

en: He lived idly and found himself already forty years old.
zh: 他一直混日子，回过头发现自己都四十岁了。

en: He was idly turning over the pages of a magazine.
zh: 他漫不经心地翻着一本杂志。

en: He wore a blank look.
He finished the opening.
He is nothing but a child.
He is a mere child.
He bought a Honda.
He talks big but he's never done half the things that he said he has.
zh: 他只会吹牛，说过的话连一半都没兑现过。

en: He devoted himself to the volunteer activity.
zh: 他全身心地投入到了志愿者活动中。

en: He translated Homer from the Greek into English.
zh: 他把荷马的作品从希腊语翻译成了英语。

en: He is about my age.
He is almost six feet tall.
He is wiser and more careful than Bob.
zh: 他比鲍勃更聪明，也更细心。

en: He came back by way of Honolulu.
zh: 他是路过檀香山回来的。

en: He seldom, if ever, comes.
zh: 他很少来，甚至可以说根本不来。

en: He seldom, if ever, goes to see the movies.
zh: 他很少去看电影，甚至可以说根本不看。

en: He comes here almost every day.
He comes to see me nearly every day.
zh: 他差不多每天都来看我。

en: He has few or no books.
He hardly works.
He is little short of a genius.
He had little social life.
zh: 他几乎没有什么社交生活。

en: He came home at almost midnight.
He has little confidence in himself.
He had few teeth.
He is all but dead.
He is little better than a beggar.
He is little, if at all, inferior to you.
zh: 他就算比你差，也差不了多少。

en: He is little, if at all inferior to you.
zh: 他就算比你差，也差不了多少。

en: He, like most Incas, believed this story.
zh: 像大多数印加人一样，他也相信这个故事。

en: He could make himself agreeable to almost anyone.
zh: 他几乎跟谁都能处得来。

en: He has all but finished the work.
zh: 他的活儿差不多都干完了。

en: He is almost always at home.
He is almost always home.
He had to share the hotel room with a stranger.
zh: 他不得不跟个陌生人合住一间酒店房间。

en: He runs a lot of hotels.
He is the manager of a hotel.
He earns his living as a hotel boy.
zh: 他在酒店当服务生养活自己。

en: He drove down to the hotel.
He's staying at a hotel.
He called a hotel for accommodations.
He had difficulty in finding his way to the hotel.
zh: 他费了好大劲才找到去酒店的路。

en: He stayed at a hotel for a couple of days.
Bodybuilding is his hobby so he has a very firm tight body with lots of muscle definition.
zh: 他喜欢健身，所以身材很结实，肌肉线条很明显。

en: He stood aloof.
He stood all by himself.
He stood by himself.
He pressed the button and waited.
He stuck a flower in his buttonhole.
zh: 他在纽扣眼里插了一朵花。

en: He is cross with his boss.
He is loyal to his boss.
He lives in Boston.
He bought a round-trip ticket to Boston.
zh: 他买了一张去波士顿的往返票。

en: He came here by way of Boston.
zh: 他是路过波士顿来这里的。

en: He has come from Boston.
He dropped a letter into the mailbox.
He is allergic to dust.
He felt in his pocket for his wallet.
He has fallen into the habit of putting his hands into his pockets.
zh: 他养成了把手插在兜里的习惯。

en: He was standing with his hands in his pockets.
He felt in his pocket for his keys.
He felt in his pocket for his lighter.
He stood against the wall with his hands in his pockets.
zh: 他手插在兜里靠墙站着。

en: He was standing by the gate with his hand in his pocket.
zh: 他一只手揣在兜里，站在大门口。

en: He put his hands in his pockets.
He thrust the money into his pocket.
He emptied his pockets of their contents.
zh: 他把兜里的东西全都掏了出来。

en: He took something out of his pocket.
zh: 他从兜里掏出了个东西。

en: He has much more money than I have.
He has a lot more money than I have.
He put an interesting idea before us.
zh: 他给我们提了个挺有意思的想法。

en: He was standing there with a vacant look.
zh: 他眼神空洞地站在那儿。

en: He is tolerant in religious belief of others.
zh: 他对别人的宗教信仰很宽容。

en: He did the work better than anyone else.
zh: 他这活儿做得比谁都好。

en: He decided to seek information elsewhere.
zh: 他决定去别处打听打听。

en: He had heard some other stories.
He threw the ball against the wall.
He kicked the ball.
He threw the ball.
He jumped to get a ball.
He got the ball.

en: He hammered out a home run.

en: He explained the process of building a boat.
He boarded the ship.
He was listening with his chin resting on his hand.
zh: 他托着下巴在那儿听着。

en: He rested his chin on his hands.
He is very good at poker.

en: He was sitting on a bench.

en: He sat on the bench.

en: He is not sitting on a bench.

en: He is a heroin addict.

He arrived after the bell rang.

en: He is made of money.
He was guilty of a blunder.
He's not at all afraid of snakes.
He is not scared of snakes at all.
He's not afraid of snakes at all.
He was tired out.

He is an expert driver.
He is a poet of a sort.
He made do with a bed of grass.

en: He doesn't have any pets.
He dragged himself to bed.
He's gentle with our pets.

en: As soon as he went to bed, he fell fast asleep, for he was very tired.

en: He sat on the bed.
He lay down on the bed.
He lay asleep in the bed.
He was lying in bed a long time.
He lay on his back on the bed.
He rolled off the bed.
He jumped out of bed.
He made a fortune by writing a best selling novel.

en: I think he will become a Beethoven.

en: He stood against the wall.
He stood leaning against the fence.
He made it clear that he had no intention of becoming a professional football player.

en: He went abroad to raise fund for the project.
zh: 他出国为这个项目筹款。

en: He ran water into the bathtub.
He is able to play the flute.
He can play a flute.
He can play the flute.
He pressed the brake pedal.
He is well acquainted with French literature.
He is very knowledgeable about French literature.
zh: 他对法国文学很有研究。

en: He was a Frenchman, as I discovered from his accent.
zh: 我从口音听出他是个法国人。

en: He was a Frenchman. I could tell by his accent.
He can speak French, and it goes without saying he can speak English too.
zh: 他会说法语，不用说，英语肯定也会。

en: He can speak French, and obviously English.
zh: 他会说法语，显然也会说英语。

en: Can he speak French?
He could speak French.
He cannot speak French without making a few mistakes.
He speaks French and that very well.
He both speaks and writes French.
He can speak and write French.
He speaks French.
He doesn't speak French, neither do I.
zh: 他不会说法语，我也不会。

en: He tried to learn French.
He will study French.
He translated French into Japanese.
zh: 他把法语翻译成了日语。

en: He can't read French, much less write it.
zh: 他连法语都看不懂，更别说写了。

en: He knows French, much more English.
He can speak French well.
He was taught French and given a dictionary.
zh: 有人教他法语，还送了他一本词典。

en: He is second to none in his command of French.
He went to Paris to study French.
He is capable of teaching French.
He has a good knowledge of French.
He could not speak French well.
He can also speak French.
He also speaks French.
He knows neither French nor German.

en: He answered that he knew no French.
He doesn't speak English, and don't even mention French.
zh: 他连英语都不会，更别提法语了。

en: He doesn't know French at all.
He is at home in French.
He tried to master French.
He managed to read a book written in French.
zh: 他好不容易读完了一本法语书。

en: Not only does he speak French, he can also speak English.
zh: 他不仅会说法语，还会说英语。

en: He speaks Spanish as well as French.

en: He doesn't just speak French, he speaks Spanish as well.
zh: 他不光会说法语，还会说西班牙语。

en: He not only speaks French, but he speaks Spanish, too.

en: He can speak French, and even more English.

en: He is fluent in French.
He speaks French fluently.
He has a good command of French.
He understands French.
He has a good reading knowledge of French.
zh: 他的法语阅读能力不错。

en: He is proficient in both Spanish and Italian.
zh: 他的西班牙语和意大利语都很精通。

en: He is acquainted with the modern history of France.
zh: 他对法国现代史很了解。

en: He has visited France three times.
He decided to go to France.
He went to Paris, which is the capital of France.
He has not been to France.
He has been to France.
He was walking up and down the station platform.
He remembers Mr Black's car.
zh: 他记得布莱克先生的车。

en: He is fond of wandering about.
He announced his engagement to Miss Brown.
zh: 他宣布了和布朗小姐订婚的消息。

en: He is on good terms with Mr Brown.
zh: 他和布朗先生的关系很好。

en: He gets on well with Mr. Brown.
zh: 他和布朗先生处得很好。

en: He's on good terms with Mr. Brown.
zh: 他跟布朗先生挺合得来的。

en: Such was his pride that he could not bring himself to ignore the insult.
zh: 他这人自尊心太强，没法对那种侮辱坐视不管。

en: He makes wine from grapes.
He has been reading a book for four hours on end.
zh: 他连续看了四个小时的书。

en: He is captain of the football team.
He is mad about football.
He said so with humor.
He looks old, but he is still in his twenties.
zh: 他看着显老，其实才二十多岁。

en: He's very fair-minded.
He was poisoned by the globefish he ate.
He was away from the swimming pool.
zh: 他当时没在游泳池那儿。

en: He scraped the mud off his boots.
zh: 他把靴子上的泥刮掉了。

en: He interrupted us abruptly.
He interfered with the fans.
He is absorbed in the study of the Fuzzy Theory.
He turned the bottle upside down and shook it, but still the honey wouldn't come out.
zh: 他把瓶子倒过来摇了摇，可蜂蜜还是倒不出来。

en: He is proud of never having been beaten in ping-pong.
zh: 他对他打乒乓球从没输过这事挺得意的。

en: He drank orange juice out of a bottle.
He took Bill swimming.
When he entered the building, he was frightened by a sudden cry.
zh: 他进楼时被突如其来的一声尖叫吓了一跳。

en: He took great pains in taming a puma.
zh: 他费了好大劲才驯服那只美洲狮。

en: He appeared hungry.
He had a hungry look.
He comes here once a month.
He has his hair cut once a month.
He gets his hair cut once a month.
The moment that he was alone he opened the letter.
The moment he was alone, he opened the letter.
zh: 他一没人在身边就把信拆开了。

en: He woke up of himself.
He figured out a principle.
For one thing he is lazy, for another he drinks.
zh: 一来他懒，二来他还爱喝酒。

en: He isn't as energetic as he once was.
zh: 他不像以前那么有干劲了。

en: He was too upset to distinguish vice from virtue.
zh: 他心烦意乱得连是非善恶都分不清了。

en: He is very depressed.
He was very poor.
He looked quite tired.
His blood is boiling.
He got very drunk.
He is in great trouble.
He is much disliked.
He is hated.
He swallowed a piece of toast because he was starving.
zh: 他饿极了，几口就吞下了一片吐司。

en: He strode along the road in a great hurry.
zh: 他急匆匆地在大路上大步流星。

en: He hurried down the road with long strides.
zh: 他迈着大步在路上疾行。

en: He wants the camera badly.
It seems that he was badly scolded.
zh: 他好像被狠狠训了一顿。

en: He was badly wounded.
He had a bad time.
He had a terrible experience.
zh: 他有过一次糟糕的经历。

en: Though he had a bad cold, he had to work.
zh: 尽管感冒得挺厉害，他还是得工作。

en: He has been suffering from a bad cold. She is very anxious about his health.
zh: 他感冒一直没好，她特别担心他的健康。

en: He has recovered from his bad cold.
He became very ill.
He is suffering from a bad cold in the nose.
He is a cruel person.
He was treated with great cruelty.
He is sadly mistaken.
He went out in spite of the heavy rain.
zh: 尽管下着大雨，他还是出门了。

en: He burned himself badly.
He is suffering from a bad cold.
He speaks English with a strong German accent.
zh: 他说英语德语口音很重。

en: He has a video.
He was so startled that he ran outside barefoot.
zh: 他吓得光着脚就跑出去了。

en: He can do the most amazing acrobatics.
zh: 他会玩特别厉害的杂技。

en: He stared at her in astonishment.
He leapt back in alarm.
It scared the daylights out of him.
He stood rooted to the spot in amazement.
zh: 他惊得呆在原地一动不动。

en: He works hard because he is anxious to succeed.
zh: 他拼命干活是因为他一心想成功。

en: He spoke under his breath.
He has designs on your property.
He was careless in handling his pistol.
zh: 他摆弄手枪时太不小心了。

en: He reached for the pistol.
He lived on crackers and water for three days.
zh: 他靠饼干和水撑了三天。

en: He made a very valuable discovery.
zh: 他有个非常有价值的发现。

en: He has a background in business.
He is not a businessman but a diplomat.
zh: 他不是个商人，而是一个外交官。

en: He elbowed me in the ribs.
zh: 他用胳膊肘捅了我肋骨一下。

en: He got down on his knees and prayed for the souls of the deceased.
zh: 他跪下来为死者的灵魂祈祷。

en: He knocked his knee against the chair.
zh: 他的膝盖撞在椅子上了。

en: His knee gave.
He is afraid of his own shadow.
zh: 他胆子小得连自己的影子都怕。

en: He is not going on the picnic, and I am not either.
He awoke with a start.
He has two Picassos.
zh: 他有两幅毕加索的作品。

en: He has a Picasso.
zh: 他有一幅毕加索的作品。

en: He obtained a picture which Picasso had painted in his later years.
zh: 他弄到了一幅毕加索晚年的画。

en: He lived to see great-grandchildren.
zh: 他活到了见着重孙辈的时候。

en: He asked for a beer.
He called for beer.
He ordered a beer.
He drank three bottles of beer.
He called for another glass of beer.
He asked for a glass of beer.
He drank that large beer mug dry.
zh: 他把那大杯啤酒喝了个精光。

en: He was drunk on beer.
He can't go without beer even for a day.
zh: 他哪怕一天不喝啤酒都不行。

en: He went out with the heater on.
He was playing the piano.
He played piano by ear.
Can he play the piano?
Does he play the piano?
He earns his living by playing the piano.
He knows how to play the piano.
He can play all the songs of the Beatles on the piano.
zh: 他能用钢琴弹奏披头士所有的歌。

en: He can play the piano, the flute, the guitar, and so on.
zh: 他会弹钢琴、吹长笛、弹吉他等等。

en: He practices the piano every day to become a pianist.
zh: 他每天练琴，是为了当上钢琴家。

en: He practices the piano every day, so he can become a pianist.
zh: 他每天练琴，这样就能当上钢琴家了。

en: He became a pianist.
He is famous as a pianist.
He drove in a nail with his hammer.
He broke up the concrete block with a hammer.
zh: 他用锤子把水泥块砸碎了。

en: He spread butter on the bread.
zh: 他在面包上抹了点黄油。

en: He had barely enough money to buy bread and milk.
zh: 他的钱勉强够买面包和牛奶。

en: He could buy bread and milk with the money he had.
zh: 他手里的钱够买面包和牛奶。

en: He turned the steering wheel the other way about.
zh: 他把方向盘往反方向打。

en: He is good at handball.
He is a handsome young man.
He is handsome and clever.
He is a gentleman, handsome, clever, and rich.
zh: 他是个绅士，长得帅、聪明还有钱。

en: He's handsome and nice, but he has no class.
zh: 他长得帅人也好，就是没什么品位。

en: He is handsome, and what is more very rich.
zh: 他长得帅，而且还特别有钱。

en: He is handsome. In addition, he is good at sport.
zh: 他长得帅，而且运动细胞也很好。

en: He took out his handkerchief.
He blew his nose in a handkerchief.
He wiped his hands on a handkerchief.
He looks as happy as if he had won a trip to Hawaii.
zh: 他高兴得就像中了夏威夷旅行大奖一样。

en: His money melted away in Hawaii.
zh: 他的钱在夏威夷很快就花光了。

en: He came all the way from abroad.
zh: 他大老远从国外赶过来。

en: He came here all the way from London.
zh: 他大老远从伦敦赶到这儿。

en: He came to see me all the way from Pakistan.
zh: 他大老远从巴基斯坦来看我。

en: He came all the way from Chicago.
zh: 他大老远从芝加哥过来。

en: He was far before his time.
He finally made up his mind to marry the girl he had met in Paris.
zh: 他终于下定决心，要娶他在巴黎认识的那个女孩。

en: He hopes he will visit Paris.
He is thinking he would like to visit Paris.
zh: 他在考虑去巴黎玩一趟。

en: He went to London via Paris.
He made a journey to Paris.
He bought a ticket for Paris.
He is due to start for Paris.
He set off to Paris.
He left for Paris.
He contemplated taking a trip to Paris.
He went to Paris, where he met me for the first time.
zh: 他去了巴黎，在那儿他第一次见到了我。

en: He arrived at Paris and immediately started for London.
zh: 他一到巴黎就马上动身去伦敦了。

en: He went to Paris, where he lived for five years.
zh: 他去了巴黎，在那儿住了五年。

en: He went to Paris, where he first met her.
zh: 他去了巴黎，在那儿第一次遇见了她。

en: He is thinking of starting another firm in Paris.
zh: 他正考虑在巴黎再开一家公司。

en: He is proud of having been educated in Paris.
zh: 他挺以在巴黎受过教育为荣的。

en: He failed to wake Harry up.
He succeeded in waking Harry up.
He lost his balance and fell off his bicycle.
zh: 他失去平衡，从自行车上摔了下来。

en: He is cultivating roses.
He waited for his son with anxiety.
He painted a picture of roses.
He played the part of Hamlet.
zh: 他演了哈姆雷特这个角色。

en: He was cast as Hamlet.
zh: 他被选去演哈姆雷特了。

en: He likes ham and eggs.
He backed abruptly away.
He got a good grip on the bat before swinging.
He hit a ball with the bat.
He hit the ball with the bat.
He is at home on batting.
He laid his bag on the table.
He closed the door suddenly.
He likes bread and butter.
zh: 他喜欢涂了黄油的面包。

en: He became enthusiastic about personal computers.
He's waiting at the bus stop.
Does he go to school by bus?
He made a dash for the bus.
He broke into the bus queue.
He got off the bus.
He was involved in the puzzle.

en: He took out his passport.
He is a bus driver.
He organized a boycott of the bus service.

en: He may have missed the bus.
He hurried so as to catch the bus.
zh: 他急匆匆地去赶公交车。

en: He ran fast so as to catch the bus.
Did he come by bus or by train?
zh: 他是坐公交来的还是坐火车来的？

en: He visited Nara by bus.

en: He commutes to his office by bus.
Does he go to work by bus?
He will come to the station by bus.
He likes tennis rather than basketball.
zh: 比起篮球，他更喜欢网球。

en: He is good at basketball.
He comes to school by bus or train.
zh: 他坐公交或者火车上学。

en: He was reading a newspaper in his pajamas.
The guests caught him in his pajamas.
zh: 客人来时正碰上他穿着睡衣。

en: He is in pajamas.
He wore a robe over his pajamas.
zh: 他在睡衣外面披了件睡袍。

en: He mentioned her name for the first time.
zh: 他第一次提到了她的名字。

en: He didn't believe it at first.
He ascended the ladder halfway.
He put his foot on the ladder.
He filled the bucket with water.
He is polite to a fault.
He accumulated a large fortune.
He is being foolish.
He acted the fool.
I look upon him as a fool.
He did something stupid and was sneered at.
zh: 他干了件蠢事，被人嘲笑了。

en: He is foolish.
He's stupid.
He acted foolishly.
He was laughed at for a stupid act.
zh: 他因为做了蠢事被人取笑。

en: He flapped the flies away.
He asked for pie, and I ordered the same.
zh: 他要了份派，我也点了一样的。

en: He gave up his dream of becoming a pilot.
zh: 他放弃了当飞行员的梦想。

en: He made up his mind to be a pilot.
zh: 他下定决心要当一名飞行员。

en: He spoke with a pipe in his mouth.
He is anxious for a motorbike.
He's got not only a motorbike but also a car.
zh: 他不仅有摩托车，还有辆汽车。

en: He came up with a party of hikers.
zh: 他赶上了一群徒步旅行的人。

en: He is scraping on the violin.
He is a good violinist, isn't he?
zh: 他小提琴拉得很好，不是吗？

en: He is a good violinist.
zh: 他是个优秀的小提琴家。

en: He ran up the stairs panting.
zh: 他气喘吁吁地跑上了楼。

en: He is a student at Harvard.
He's a professor of biology at Harvard.
zh: 他是哈佛的生物学教授。

en: He is studying law at Harvard.
He studied law at Harvard.
zh: 他以前在哈佛读过法律。

en: He was very tired by hard work.
He's a party animal.
He appeared at the party late.
He will be coming to the party.
He wasn't able to attend the party.
He didn't show up at the party.
He decided not to go to the party.
He cooked up a good excuse for not going to the party.
zh: 为了不去派对，他编了个好借口。

en: He introduced me to her at the party.
zh: 他在派对上把我介绍给了她。

en: He acted out a pantomime at the party.
zh: 他在派对上表演了哑剧。

en: He was very kind to me at the party.
zh: 他在派对上对我挺热情的。

en: He has to make a speech at the party.
He added that he had a wonderful time at the party.
zh: 他补充说他在派对上玩得很开心。

en: He enjoyed a life of leisure.
He muttered a curse.
He stuck his neck out for that idea, and now he's getting all the blame.
zh: 他为了那个主意强出头，结果现在全是他在背锅。

en: He won the fight by a knockout.
He died by the roadside.
He has an ambition to get a Nobel Prize.
zh: 他有拿诺贝尔奖的雄心。

en: He took a notebook out.
He wrote down her name in the notebook.
zh: 他在笔记本上记下了她的名字。

en: He is as timid as a mouse.
He has a cat and two dogs.
He was accused of theft.
Not liking carrots, he didn't eat it.
zh: 因为不喜欢胡萝卜，他没吃。

en: He does not like carrots, so he did not eat it.
zh: 他不喜欢胡萝卜，所以没吃。

en: He hopped on a freight train bound for New York.
zh: 他跳上了一列开往纽约的货运火车。

en: He knows New York inside out.
He went to New York by airplane.
He moved to New York, where he looked for a job.
zh: 他搬到了纽约并在那里找了份工作。

en: He has a business in New York.
Having been living in New York for three years, he knows many good restaurants there.
zh: 他在纽约住了三年，知道那里很多好吃的餐馆。

en: He will be in New York for two weeks.
He stayed in New York for three weeks.
He made a lot of money in New York and went back to the small town where he was born.
zh: 他在纽约赚了大钱，回他出生的那个小镇了。

en: He patted me on the shoulder with a smile.
zh: 他笑着拍了拍我的肩膀。

en: He would smile his approval.
zh: 他会报以微笑表示赞许。

en: He patted me on the back with a smile.
He stared at her with hatred.
What a mean fellow he is!
How old he is!
How fast he can run!
How fast he runs!
What an impressive person he is!
What a bad boy he is!
I don't know why, but he seems to have it in for me.
zh: 不知道为什么，他好像总在针对我。

en: How well he can skate.
How soundly he is sleeping!
He was somehow able to swim across the river.
He somehow managed to swim across the river.
He could manage a week's holiday.
zh: 他能抽出一周时间休假。

en: How well he played!
What a genius he is!
He is misfortune.
What a tall boy he is!
What a clever boy he is!
What a big eater he is!
How big he is!
What a kind boy he is!
How kind of him to help us move on such a rainy day!
zh: 这种下雨天他还来帮我们搬家，人真好！

en: What a disagreeable fellow he is!
How fluently he speaks English!
What a fast swimmer he is.
He cried out what a nice day it was.
He knows whatever.
He knows everything.
He wants to have everything his own way.
zh: 他凡事都想按自己的意思来。

en: I am afraid he is going to spill the beans.
zh: 我怕他会把秘密给说漏了。

en: He makes mountains out of molehills.
What a nonsense he talks.
What a lot of books he has!
He hates Nancy.
He asked Nancy if she was free the next day.
zh: 他问南希第二天有没有空。

en: He contrived a means of speaking to Nancy privately.
zh: 他设法找机会和南希私下谈话。

en: He caught sight of Nancy getting into a taxi.
zh: 他瞥见南希上了一辆出租车。

en: He tends to be idle.
He did nothing wrong; all the same he was severely punished.
zh: 他没做错什么，可还是受了重罚。

en: He did nothing but fold his arms.
zh: 他什么也没做，只是交叉双手抱着胳膊。

en: He whispered something in her ear.
zh: 他在她耳边小声说了些什么。

en: He began to play an old song.
Why did he fail in business?
zh: 他做生意怎么就失败了呢？

en: He had no idea why his wife left him.
zh: 他搞不懂老婆为什么要离开他。

en: He wondered to himself why his wife had left him.
zh: 他纳闷老婆为什么要离开他。

en: Why can't he play tennis today?
zh: 他今天怎么没法打网球？

en: He gave no explanation why he had been absent.
zh: 他没解释他之前为什么没来。

en: Why did he go out in a hurry?
I wonder why he was absent.
I wonder why he did not come to the party.
zh: 我纳闷他怎么没来聚会。

en: Why did he ask for so much money?
Why did he do that?
He looks blue for some reason.
zh: 不知道为什么，他看着挺郁闷的。

en: I know why he did it.
zh: 我知道他为什么要这样做。

en: He gave her what little money he had.
zh: 他把身上仅有的一点钱全都给了她。

en: He lent me what little money he had.
zh: 他把手里仅有的一点钱都借给我了。

en: He searched the room for the lost key.
zh: 他在屋里到处找弄丢的钥匙。

en: He is a pretty great guy.
He is the person who is difficult to come to terms with.
He is rather hard to get along with.
He is a man of spirit.
He has great confidence in himself.
He reads a good deal.
He is the last man to submit to authority.
zh: 他绝不是那种会向权势低头的人。

en: He is very handsome.
He is quite a nice fellow and liked by everyone.
zh: 他人挺好的，大家都挺喜欢他。

en: He cut the meat with a knife.
He was sharpening a knife.
He hurt his left hand with a knife.
zh: 他拿刀把左手给割伤了。

en: He cut a twig from the tree with his knife.
zh: 他用刀从树上削了个小树枝。

en: He turned a somersault.
He'll clutch at any straw.
zh: 哪怕是根稻草他也会死命抓着的。

en: He doesn't heed any advice.
He was impatient of any delays.
What is he like?
What line is he in?
What kind of job is he fit for?
How did he behave?
He's capable of wickedness of any kind.
zh: 他这种人什么坏事都做得出来。

en: He is the first to come and the last to leave at any party.
zh: 不管什么聚会，他总是来得最早、走得最晚。

en: He writes home to his parents at least once a month, no matter how busy he is.
zh: 不管多忙，他每个月至少给父母写一封信。

en: However tired he is, he writes in his diary before going to bed.
zh: 不管多累，他睡觉前都要写日记。

en: No matter how tired he is, he writes in his diary before going to bed.
zh: 不管多累，他睡前都会写日记。

en: No matter how angry he was, he would never resort to violence.
zh: 他这人脾气再大，也绝不会动手打人。

en: How he has suffered!
No matter how hard he tried, my opinion didn't change.
zh: 不管他怎么努力，我还是没改变主意。

en: However hard he may try, he won't succeed.
zh: 哪怕他再努力，也不会成功的。

en: Regardless of how much he drank, he seems as sober as ever.
zh: 不管喝了多少，他看着都跟没事人一样。

en: He likes all kinds of sports.
zh: 各种运动他都挺喜欢的。

en: He walked on and on.
He is quite frank with me about everything.
zh: 他对我什么事都很坦白。

en: He walked on and on, his dog following.
zh: 他一直走啊走，后面还跟着他的狗。

en: He walked rapidly.
He has risen to the present position by leaps and bounds.
He is a quick-witted man.
He ran on and on.
How fast does he run?
No matter how hard he may work, he will not be able to pass the exams.
zh: 不管他多努力，他都考不及格。

en: He particularly liked history.
He likes swimming above all.
He can cut the cards well.
He hates falsehood more than anything else.
He doesn't have the time to play cards.
He is an easy mark at cards.
He's good at cards.
He shot a tiger through the head.
zh: 他一枪打穿了老虎的头。

en: He pulled aside to let a truck pass.
zh: 他靠边停了一下，让卡车过去。

en: He's dry and unemotional.
He was knocked down by a truck.
He has a Toyota.
He tended to be lenient toward the children.
zh: 他对孩子总是比较宽容。

en: He's shorter than Tom.
He's much younger than Tom.
He saw Tom leave before the job was finished.
zh: 活还没干完，他就看到汤姆走了。

en: He is by far the most sensible.
zh: 他是所有人里最懂事的。

en: He was doubtful about which way to take.
He is every bit a scholar.
zh: 他十足是个学者的样子。

en: What degree of interest did he show?
zh: 他表现出了多大的兴趣？

en: He can run as fast as any other boy.
zh: 他跑得不比任何一个男孩子慢。

en: He works as hard as any student.
zh: 他学习跟谁都一样努力。

en: How did he work out the plan?
zh: 他是怎么制定出这个计划的？

en: How did he work out the big problem?
zh: 他是怎么解决那个大难题的？

en: How long has he been absent?
How long has he lived in London?
He eats, breathes and sleeps computers.
zh: 他是个电脑迷，满脑子都是电脑。

en: He is Tony.
He's Tony.
He decided to stay and carry on his father's business.
zh: 他决定留下来继承他父亲的生意。

en: He is such a nice person that everybody likes him.
zh: 他人特别好，大家都喜欢他。

en: He was such a bright boy others admired him.
zh: 这孩子太聪明了，大家都挺佩服他的。

en: He's a very selfish person.
He is very careful.
Such was his eloquence that everybody was moved to tears.
zh: 他口才太好了，大家都感动得流泪了。

en: He is very rich, but he is none the happier for his wealth.
zh: 他很有钱，但并没因此感到更快乐。

en: He is so mild in disposition that I have never heard him speak in a loud voice.
zh: 他脾气特别温和，我从没听他大声说过话。

en: He told us such a funny story that we all laughed.
zh: 他讲的故事太逗了，大家都笑了。

en: He seems very busy. I can't come into contact with him.
zh: 他看起来很忙，我联系不上他。

en: He is very afraid of his mother.
He is so impolite that everyone hates him.
zh: 他这人太没礼貌了，大家都讨厌他。

en: He was so poor that he could not buy the bread.
zh: 他穷得连面包都买不起。

en: He looks very tired.
He was so tired that he couldn't walk.
He was too tired to walk any farther.
He was very tired, so he went to bed early.
zh: 他太累了，所以早早就睡了。

en: As he was so tired, he fell fast asleep.
zh: 因为太累了，他很快就睡着了。

en: Since he was very tired, he fell sound asleep.
zh: 因为他非常累，所以睡得很香。

en: He was very tall, so I recognized him at once.
zh: 他长得特别高，所以我一眼就认出他了。

en: He was very tired.
He is such a tall man that he can reach the ceiling.
zh: 他个子特别高，手都能碰到天花板。

en: He was very old.
Although he is very old, he is strong.
zh: 虽然他年纪大了，但身体还很硬朗。

en: He studies very hard.
He studies biology very hard.
He can be reliable in that he is very patient.
zh: 他这人很有耐心，挺靠谱的。

en: He is too shy to talk to girls.
zh: 他太害羞了，不敢跟女孩子说话。

en: He is very bright, and what is more, he studies hard.
zh: 他很聪明，而且学习还特别努力。

en: He is very clever and is not proud either.
zh: 他很聪明，而且一点儿也不自大。

en: He is very angry.
He was too angry to speak.
He was so angry as to be unable to speak.
zh: 他当时气得话都说不出来。

en: He was so angry he couldn't speak.
zh: 他气得连话都说不了了。

en: For all his efforts, he didn't succeed.
zh: 尽管他这么努力，最后还是没成功。

en: He was all attention.
He gave us such a long assignment that we protested.
zh: 他留的作业多得让我们都有意见了。

en: He wore a very loud necktie.
zh: 他戴了一条特别扎眼的领带。

en: He is a very lazy boy.
He is very fat, that is, he weighs 300 pounds.
zh: 他特别胖，也就是说他体重有三百磅。

en: He was so fat that he couldn't get through the hole.
zh: 他胖得连那个洞都钻不过去。

en: He walked so fast this I couldn't keep up with him.
zh: 他走得太快了，我根本跟不上他。

en: He can swim very fast.
He ran so fast that we couldn't catch up with him.
zh: 他跑得特别快，我们都追不上他。

en: He is able to swim very fast.
He walked away too quickly for me to catch up with him.
zh: 他走得太快，我没能追上他。

en: He drives very fast.
He's so rude. I can't put up with his bad manners.
zh: 他这人太没礼貌了，我受不了他那态度。

en: He is very honest in business.
He is a very sincere person.
He is so honest that I can count on him.
zh: 他这人很诚实，值得信赖。

en: He's very honest, so we can depend on him.
zh: 他很老实，我们可以信任他。

en: He's very honest, so we can rely on him.
zh: 他这人很实在，我们可以指望他。

en: He is very honest.
Though he is so worldly-wise, he is still very young.
zh: 虽然他为人处世很老练，但其实还很年轻。

en: He would be the last person to betray others.
zh: 他绝不是那种会出卖别人的人。

en: He looks very friendly, but I suspect him all the same.
zh: 他看着挺面善的，但我还是有点怀疑他。

en: He went through a very hard time.
zh: 他过了一段非常艰难的日子。

en: He was so kind as to show her the way.
zh: 他心肠很好，还特意给她指了路。

en: He is very friendly, so I enjoy working with him.
zh: 他很友好，我很喜欢跟他一起工作。

en: He is always kind enough to help me any time.
zh: 他人特别好，随时都愿意帮我。

en: He was kindness itself.
He really cares for his parents.
He can play tennis very well.
He is too sensitive.
He is a man of great importance.
zh: 他是个很有头有脸的人物。

en: He is often taken for a student because he looks so young.
zh: 他长得特别年轻，经常被误认为是学生。

en: He started going bald quite young.
zh: 他年纪轻轻就开始秃顶了。

en: He's very young. He's much younger than Tom.
zh: 他很年轻，比汤姆小多了。

en: He is very young.
He is a very thoughtful person.
He is a very modest man.
He has a very expensive watch.
He is so aggressive that others avoid him.
zh: 他太有攻击性了，大家都躲着他。

en: He feels very happy.
He seemed to have been very happy.
zh: 他那时候看着挺开心的。

en: They looked very happy.
He was very thirsty and asked for some water.
zh: 他渴得厉害，要了点水喝。

en: He's very smart, so everybody likes him.
zh: 他挺聪明的，大家都喜欢他。

en: He is too smart not to know it.
zh: 他这么聪明，不可能不知道。

en: He's very ill.
He is very sick.
He is anxious to see you.
He really wants to meet you.
He has a very surprising fancy.
zh: 他的想法挺出人意料的。

en: He was so frightened that he could not speak for a moment.
zh: 他吓得一时半会儿说不出话来。

en: He was so interested that he gave it his attention.
He became so excited that what he said made no sense at all.
He is such a difficult boy.
He is as cross as a bear today.
He behaves in a very strange fashion.
He is strong as a horse.
He's as strong as a horse.
He is very a dangerous man.
He talks very cheerfully.
He seems very pleasant.
He was very fun.
Though he is very learned, he lacks common sense.
zh: 别看他很有学问，但其实没啥常识。

en: He is too much of a coward to attempt it.
zh: 他胆子太小了，根本不敢尝试。

en: He is such a bad person that everybody dislikes him.
zh: 他这人太坏了，大家都不待见他。

en: He's a very romantic boyfriend who brings me flowers each night.
zh: 他是个特别浪漫的男朋友，每天晚上都给我带花。

en: He thinks that only very well trained actors can be really successful.
zh: 他觉得只有受过专业训练的演员才能真正成功。

en: He has gained so much that he can soon go home from the hospital.
zh: 他恢复得很好，很快就能出院回家了。

en: He has gotten better, so he'll soon be able to leave the hospital.
zh: 他好多了，很快就能出院了。

en: He asked a very good question.
zh: 他提了一个挺好的问题。

en: He is a very good batter.
zh: 他是个很出色的击球手。

en: He is a very earnest person.
He made his suggestion very tactfully.
He fell lamentably short of his duty.
He is eager to go there.
I don't like him because he is sly as a fox.
zh: 我不喜欢他，他这人跟狐狸一样狡猾。

en: He's a very fine musician.
zh: 他是个很出色的音乐家。

en: He is a good tennis player.
He is very stingy with his money.
He's very stingy.
He was such a nice boy that he was loved by everybody.
zh: 他是个挺好的孩子，大家都特别喜欢他。

en: He had a very heavy study program.
He is very bright, and his brother is as bright.
zh: 他很聪明，他兄弟也一样。

en: They say he is very rich.
They say that he is very rich.
He has an interesting book.
zh: 他有一本挺有意思的书。

en: He has a very interesting book.
zh: 他有一本特别有意思的书。

en: He looked very happy.
Even if he's very nice, I don't really trust him.
zh: 就算他人很好，我也不是特别信任他。

en: He looked really wonderful in his top hat and tails.
zh: 他穿大礼帽和燕尾服的样子帅呆了。

en: He is fine and gentle.
He was a disagreeable old man.
zh: 他是个很难相处的老头。

en: Which direction did he go?
He's sitting on the fence.
He couldn't make up his mind which course to follow.
zh: 他没法决定该走哪条路。

en: He was at a loss which way to take.
He can write with either hand.
He is, if anything, tall.
zh: 真要说的话，他个子挺高的。

en: He is rather an active person.
I'd like to know which he likes.
zh: 我想知道他喜欢哪一个。

en: He gets lost wherever he goes.
zh: 他不管去哪儿都会迷路。

en: He disappeared, taking advantage of the confusion.
Go where he will, he will be welcomed.
zh: 无论去哪儿，他都会很受欢迎。

en: He was welcome wherever he went.
zh: 他以前不管去哪儿都很受欢迎。

en: He did not know where to go.
I wonder where he has gone.
zh: 我在想他到底去哪儿了。

en: He told me where to go.
Where was he going?
He has a good reputation no matter where he goes.
zh: 不管去哪儿，他的名声都很好。

en: Where does he come from?
Where is he standing?
Where do you think he lives?
He radiates happiness around wherever he goes.
zh: 他不管走到哪儿都能给人带来快乐。

en: He told me where to shop.
zh: 他告诉了我去哪儿买东西。

en: Where was he born?
He begins to sketch no matter where he is.
zh: 不管他在哪儿，他都会开始画画。

en: Where did he find the money?
I'm afraid something is wrong with him.
zh: 我担心他是不是出什么事了。

en: He is every bit a gentleman.
He was every inch a king.
zh: 他浑身上下都透着国王的派头。

en: He appeared from nowhere.
zh: 他不知道从哪儿冒出来的。

en: He looks every inch a gentleman.
zh: 他看起来是个十足的绅士。

en: He went to some place or other.
One must be an executive in some company.
zh: 一个人总得在某家公司当个高管。

en: He must be somewhere about.
He lives somewhere around the park.
He lives some where about the park.
He lives somewhere near that park.
He lives somewhere about here.
He sometimes eats lunch there, too.
zh: 他有时也会在那儿吃午饭。

en: He sometimes sleeps in.
He sometimes goes to work by car.
He sometimes drops in on me.
He sometimes visits me.
